intro: Platyosprion platycarpum, commonly known as the broad-fruited flat-sprout, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant produces oval, flat fruits that are typically borne in umbels, a feature common in the carrot family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
